get.description: This API returns the current IP status (instead of configuration) of AP interfaces.
Note: This API always returns 8 SSIDs.

patch.description:
Note: currently this API only supports PSK
For [PATCH] method on wlan-setting API, it will only update the SSID Pre-Shared-Key (PSK), no matter the SSID security mode is WPA2/3 or not.

post.description: Logout AP users in the site. Every AP will be instructed to logout the users.

get.description:
Get the organizations

- **name**: Org's name
- **orgId**: Org's unique ID
- **mode**: Org's license mode

get.summary: Get Device Firmware Status From An Org
Get Device Firmware Status From A Site

post.description: Site-wide clients data in the last 2 hours.
AP clients data in the last 2 hours.

Ping the target address.
The token must be null to initialize the ping task, and then use the returned token to fetch the results.
Start the switch device's cable diagnostics test.
The device connectivity status in the last 2hr/1d/7d/30d

Site-wide clients data in the last 2hr/1d/7d/30d.
Response data key is macAddress.

AP clients data in the last 2hr/1d/7d/30d.
Response data key is macAddress.

SW clients data in the last 2hr/1d/7d/30d.
Response data keys are macAddress and vlan.

GW clients data in the last 2hr/1d/7d/30d.
Firewall Respone data keys are macAddress, ipv4Address and interface.
SCR Respone data key is macAddress.

get.description:
The current IP status (instead of configuration) of the Switch device.
Only one IP data is returned in the array for now.

portNum.description: the port is being used for the uplink connection

siteId.description: If siteId is null, the device is under the org but not assigned to any site.
